item.description:
Values:

1. We believe that a long-term, fulfilling relationship is built on some fundamental values: Integrity, Honesty, Respect, Loyalty, Reliability, and Non-judgment in our communication with each other. We value each other’s opinion.
2. We strive to be positive, optimistic, kind, giving professionals. How? We don’t criticize, condemn or complain.
3. We value diversity in religions, nationalities, and ethnic backgrounds. We cooperate as a team to be successful by inviting other professional people we know.
4. We demonstrate this respectful/ nonjudgmental mindset in two ways:
A. By saying Yes to someone who asks us to dance. (once)
B. By offering positive solutions or alternatives if you disagree with something. (Please don’t criticize, condemn or complain)

Please invite other friends, particularly men. My personal goal is to have an equal amount of men and women. We are very close on equal numbers of men and women.

The synergistic efforts of everyone will make it truly a memorable dance party.

Organizer/Host - Richard Tosti

Format:
Location is in a warm, loving and relaxing environment.
"Dress code - "business casual" – NO JEANS OR SNEAKERS

7:30pm - 11:30pm
Saturday, December 13, 2008
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA
Maximum attendees 160- All denominations welcome
Dancing will be available - DJ

***The entry fee is $12.00 plus wine or food assignment listed below.
Of course if you are unable to bring anything, then your entry fee will be $20.00.

Buffet which will start at 8:00
Request from Rabbi Abramson (no shellfish, shrimp, scallops, Lobster or pork)

Open Bar - wine/beer

If your last name begins with the following letter please bring the following.
Each person bring one of the following:

A-C tossed salad / vegetable tray with dip (make sure to include dressing)

D-J Italian entrée – only suggestions - meatballs / peppers & onions / ziti with sauce / finger sandwichs, chicken wings, pizza, baked stuffed shells / linguini with sauce and of course cheese/lasagna,/ chicken with broccoli & ziti / vegetable lasagna / calzones / pizza / baked macaroni and cheese. (take servings for 8)

K-R wine or beer

S-T Italian bread and butter – with 1 bottle soda

U-V 2 bottles soda (1 diet & 1 regular) and 2 gallons of water

W-Z dessert - only suggestions – Italian cookies, pie, cake, Brownie Sunday with sauce and whipped cream, blueberry pie, apple pie,

160 guests only- waiting list guests might be able to get in the day before-20 people will cancel because of family emergency or sickness

Location and Directions
Temple Shalom Emeth, 16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

128 North
Exit 32B Middlesex Turnpike (Burlington/Arlington)
At the end of the ramp turn right onto Middlesex Turnpike - on the left is Barnes/Noble
After the Burlington Mall turn right on to Burlington Mall Rd. - on left is Longs Jewelers
Take left after you pass Kohl’s on your left which is Lexington Street
Temple Shalom Emeth is on your left at16 Lexington Street, Burlington, MA

We have permission to park across the street - McGinnis Ave., - Mt Hope Church.
Once the main parking lot fills up next to Temple Shalom Emeth.

You know the time, the location and what you should bring so let’s have fun!
See you on Saturday, December 13 at 7:30pm----7:00pm for cha-cha lesson with Arthur Murray Studios- and review of Salsa lesson.

other options-
age group 30-50- www.dance.meetup.com/582/calendar/
Jewish Singles only- 30 plus--www.meetup.com/Jewish-Dance-Party-Plus/

The best is yet to be!
Richard Tosti
item.name: Private Singles Party 40-65
